title: Provide a way to get feedback on compiler error rates

labels.name: C-enhancement
labels.description: Category: An issue proposing an enhancement or a PR with one.

labels.name: A-diagnostics
labels.description: Area: Messages for errors, warnings, and lints

labels.name: metabug
labels.description: Issues about issues themselves ("bugs about bugs")

labels.name: T-compiler
labels.description: Relevant to the compiler team, which will review and decide on the PR/issue.

body:
As per https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/pull/45452#issuecomment-339329308, and [other conversations](https://internals.rust-lang.org/search?q=telemetry) that have been had over time, there's a feeling that we should have ways of identifying what `rustc` features are being used/encountered. This can range from full featured telemetry support in `rustc`/`cargo`, to a simple webapp accepting people to post compiler output. Right now the only ways we receive feedback for confusing output are:

 - IRC/gitter
 - this issue tracker
 - stackoverflow
 - /r/rust

If we added telemetry support on rustc, it would also _have_ to be opt-in, and it could start with being a simple flag passed to `rustc` to send a post request with the text output of the compiler. These reports could then be aggregated by type.
